TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit FileDialogPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: Controls the ability to access files or folders through a **File** dialog box. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This permission is typically used to provide limited access to user-specified files when <xref:System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermission> is not granted.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.FileDialogPermissionAccess access) cil managed

Docs.param: A bitwise combination of the values.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified access.
Docs.exception: The parameter is not a valid combination of the values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with either restricted or unrestricted permission, as specified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates either fully restricted (`None`) or `Unrestricted` access to **File** dialog boxes.

Docs.exception: The parameter is not a valid value of .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the permitted access to files.
Docs.exception: An attempt is made to set the parameter to a value that is not a valid combination of the values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of the permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement esd) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML encoding used to reconstruct the permission.
Docs.summary: Reconstructs a permission with a specified state from an XML encoding.
Docs.exception:
The parameter is not a valid permission element.
-or-
The version number of the parameter is not supported.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission. This new permission is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe in common. Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection.

Docs.exception: The parameter is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This permission must be the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission. For example, a permission for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.FileDialogPermissionAccess.Open> access is a subset of a permission for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.FileDialogPermissionAccess.OpenSave> access.

Docs.exception: The parameter is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks An unrestricted permission represents access to all resources protected by the permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission and its current state.
Docs.returns: An XML encoding of the permission, including state information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The result of a call to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.FileDialogPermission.Union%2A> is a permission that represents all operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.

Docs.exception: The parameter is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.
